learning_outcomes.description: Correctly explain the theory and practice of modern protein analysis techniques to scientist peers using appropriate visual and oral modes of presentation.
Search protein and literature databases to obtain information about proteins and the experiments used to discover and analyse them.
Read, interpret, and re-present primary literature to peers.
Employ critical analysis of the methods, results, and discussion in primary literature (specifically in studies that address protein structure and function).
Use nucleic acid and protein bioinformatics tools to analyse problems in protein biology, biochemistry, and structure; and describe the use of these tools to an audience.
Be able to propose and justify a workable experimental design for the analysis of a protein structure and/or function.
Provide constructive criticism to a peer on their written and oral presentations and use feedback to make reflective value judgements about the quality of your own written and oral work.

assessments.task_description:
In this assignment you will review the use of an expression and purification strategy for the production of a protein in a recent research paper. Detailed instructions will be provided on the course Blackboard site.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your assessment item through the course Turnitin submission point in Blackboard. Before submitting your assessment item to Turnitin please name your file in the following way. FAMILY NAME_GivenName_StudentID_CourseCode_AssignmentName For example: Bob Smith (ID: 54329876) would name his ABCD1234 essay 1 in the following way. SMITH_Bob_54329876_ABCD1234_Essay1
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will prepare a research proposal based on expression, purification, and characterisation of a protein of interest. The research proposal will take the form of a mock grant application. Specific details and formatting requirements will be provided on the course Blackboard site. The proposal should include a summary paragraph, literature review, research hypothesis, clearly stated aims, experimental approach, expected outcomes, anticipated future research directions and a list of references.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
The examination samples knowledge from Modules 1 - 4. More information will be provided during teaching activities and/or on Blackboard. 

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
